Scenario1-AutoPay_For_ACH.TC-1: Given a valid request payload for  ACH with PersonId and ClientKey WHEN requesting to POST should return SUCCESS CODE.

Scenario2-AutoPay_For_ACH With Empty Acc.TC-1: Given request payload with Empty AccountNumber for  ACH with PersonId and ClientKey WHEN requesting to POST should get Invalid/Missed ACH Card Details in the Request.
Scenario2-AutoPay_For_ACH With Empty Acc.TC-2: Validation of ErrorCode & ACH AutoPay Details.

Scenario3-AutoPay_For_ACH With Empty Nam.TC-1: Given request payload with Empty NameOnCard for  ACH with PersonId and ClientKey WHEN requesting to POST should get Invalid/Missed ACH Card Details in the Request.
Scenario3-AutoPay_For_ACH With Empty Nam.TC-2: Validation of ErrorCode & ACH AutoPay Details.

Scenario4-AutoPay_For_ACH With Empty Ban.TC-1: Given request payload with Empty BankRoutingNumber for  ACH with PersonId and ClientKey WHEN requesting to POST should get Invalid/Missed ACH Card Details in the Request.
Scenario4-AutoPay_For_ACH With Empty Ban.TC-2: Validation of ErrorCode & ACH AutoPay Details.

Scenario5-AutoPay_For_ACH With Invalid C.TC-1: Given a valid request payload for  ACH with PersonId,Invalid ClientKey and Empty EnrolleeId WHEN requesting to POST should get Bad Request.
Scenario5-AutoPay_For_ACH With Invalid C.TC-2: Validation of ErrorCode & ACH AutoPay Details.

Scenario6-AutoPay_For_ACH With Empty Cli.TC-1: Given a valid request payload for  ACH with PersonId,Empty ClientKey and Empty EnrolleeId WHEN requesting to POST should get Bad Request.
Scenario6-AutoPay_For_ACH With Empty Cli.TC-2: Validation of ErrorCode & ACH AutoPay Details.

Scenario7-AutoPay_For_ACH With Empty Per.TC-1: Given a valid request payload for  ACH with Empty PersonId,Valid ClientKey and Empty EnrolleeId WHEN requesting to POST should get Bad Request.
Scenario7-AutoPay_For_ACH With Empty Per.TC-2: Validation of ErrorCode & ACH AutoPay Details.
